results.title: Laplanders
results.brief_description: Photographed by Swedish cameraman and film producer Arne Sucksdorff, this documentary observes the activities of the reindeer-tending Laplanders of northern Scandinavia. We see a family packing up from the mountainous summer fishing camp and crossing the high country moors with pack reindeers. When they reach their home the herd reindeers are gathered and many of the males slaughtered, every part of the body being used for food, shelter, clothing and implements. Three generations of the one family are shown.

results.title: Languages at work
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, James Mann and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of LOTE to career choices and in the workplace. Interviews people pursuing careers in which using languages is an everyday reality.

results.title: Language training series. No. 2. La Gare
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the expressions practised in actual use at a railway station in France, together with words and phrases commonly used by travellers.

results.title: Language of the deaf
results.brief_description: Explores the many ways in which deaf people enjoy all facets of life-from rock concerts to playing football - and deals with the social implications of being deaf. Highlighted is the role of Gallaudet College in Washington D.C., the only institution of higher learning in the world for the deaf.

results.title: Language of drawing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mechanical Drawing”.
This film attempts to provide a sensible and acceptable answer to the question: “Why study mechanical drawing?” and to stimulate the beginning of students’ interest in the subject.

results.title: Language of design
results.brief_description: Illustrates how Australian textile designers are finding inspiration from the local scene. Samples of sea shells, driftwood, dead twigs from a tea-tree, and other such mateerials collected on the Australian beach, are used in the studio to provide motifs for typically Australian textile designs. A series of such designs are effectively displayed by artistically draped samples.

results.title: Language development in multicultural classroom: science
results.creator_credit: Lisa Milner and Sydney College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: Focuses on how to develop specific language related to science for English as a second Language students. It shows how grade 3 and 4 explored a theme around a unit on Space, providing the viewers with both strategies and practical ideas.

results.title: Language development (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Developmental psychology today”.
Shows the most current research being done on language development, such as Dr David Premack’s work at the University of California teaching language to chimpanzees. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
